entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Ciberseguridad en la era cu√°ntica
entry.content:
El pasado evento SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos sorprendi√≥ con una charla reveladora de la mano de Carlos Ben√≠tez, CTO de Platinum Ciberseguridad, quien con su vasta experiencia nos llev√≥ por un recorrido fascinante: desde los desaf√≠os actuales de la Inteligencia Artificial hasta las amenazas inminentes de la computaci√≥n cu√°ntica



El Nuevo Escenario Digital
Carlos comenz√≥ estableciendo el contexto: las empresas dependen cada vez m√°s de sistemas cr√≠ticos como SAP, y la superficie de ataque crece exponencialmente con la digitalizaci√≥n. La ciberseguridad ya no es solo un tema t√©cnico, sino un factor estrat√©gico para la supervivencia empresarial.

IA: ¬øSuperh√©roe o Villano?
La Inteligencia Artificial se presenta con dos caras. Por un lado, herramientas como PentestGPT automatizan la detecci√≥n de vulnerabilidades sin necesidad de conocimientos profundos. Los deepfakes permiten suplantar identidades y burlar controles biom√©tricos. Y el mal uso de IA conversacional expone informaci√≥n sensible de las empresas debido a problemas de separaci√≥n entre usuarios.
Pero la IA tambi√©n se viste de superh√©roe: ayuda en la detecci√≥n y prevenci√≥n de amenazas, protege endpoints mediante XDR, y acelera la respuesta a incidentes a trav√©s de sistemas SOAR. El desaf√≠o est√° en usar estas herramientas de manera responsable.


Computaci√≥n Cu√°ntica: El Verdadero Disruptor
Aqu√≠ lleg√≥ el momento m√°s impactante de la presentaci√≥n. Carlos explic√≥ c√≥mo las computadoras cu√°nticas, que ya existen (de fabricantes como IBM, D-Wave e IonQ), cambiar√°n radicalmente el panorama de la ciberseguridad.
Estas m√°quinas pueden resolver en segundos problemas que tomar√≠an a√±os a computadoras tradicionales. El ejemplo del algoritmo de Shor fue contundente: la criptograf√≠a RSA que protege nuestras comunicaciones HTTPS, firmas digitales y transacciones blockchain ser√° vulnerable.

Dos Amenazas Reales
Carlos destac√≥ dos ataques concretos:
HTDL (Harvest Today, Decrypt Later): Atacantes est√°n capturando tr√°fico cifrado HOY, almacen√°ndolo y vendi√©ndolo en la dark web, esperando el momento en que puedan descifrarlo con computadoras cu√°nticas.
Falsificaci√≥n de Firmas Digitales: Con acceso a la clave p√∫blica, se podr√° generar la clave privada, permitiendo falsificar documentos y contratos de manera indistinguible del original.


La Soluci√≥n: Criptograf√≠a Post-Cu√°ntica
La buena noticia es que NIST ya estandariz√≥ tres algoritmos post-cu√°nticos (FIPS 203, 204 y 205) resistentes a ataques cu√°nticos. El momento de migrar es AHORA, para minimizar el "per√≠odo de riesgo" de datos cr√≠ticos que deben permanecer seguros por a√±os.
Carlos present√≥ el Teorema de Mosca, explicando visualmente por qu√© cada d√≠a que pospongamos la migraci√≥n aumenta la ventana de vulnerabilidad de nuestros datos hist√≥ricos.

SAP en la Mira
Como concentrador de procesos vitales de negocio, SAP es un objetivo especialmente atractivo. Carlos revel√≥ que SAP participa activamente en QUTAC (Quantum Technology and Application Consortium) y ya investiga criptograf√≠a quantum-safe, aunque a√∫n no hay anuncios p√∫blicos sobre la migraci√≥n completa.

Estrategia Quantum-Safe
Platinum Ciberseguridad, en alianza con IBM, ofrece un servicio estructurado en cinco fases:

  • Inventario de todos los sistemas que usan criptograf√≠a
  • Clasificaci√≥n de datos seg√∫n tiempo de vida requerido
  • Identificaci√≥n de dependencias de vendors
  • Planificaci√≥n de la migraci√≥n y mitigaciones
  • Remediaci√≥n y mantenimiento continuo

 

Conclusi√≥n
La presentaci√≥n de Carlos fue clara: prepararse hoy es la clave para un futuro seguro. La amenaza cu√°ntica no es ciencia ficci√≥n, est√° m√°s cerca de lo que pensamos. IonQ proyecta tener 8,000 qubits l√≥gicos para 2028, suficientes para romper RSA-2048.
Como comunidad SAP, debemos tomar conciencia de que la seguridad de nuestros sistemas va m√°s all√° de roles y perfiles. Es momento de evaluar riesgos presentes y futuros, fortalecer defensas t√©cnicas, y considerar socios expertos en esta transici√≥n hacia la era cu√°ntica.

Agradecemos a Platinum Ciberseguridad por compartir esta visi√≥n estrat√©gica y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por facilitar estos espacios de conocimiento. #SITCDE2025

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Planificaci√≥n Financiera Consolidada y Procesamiento de Facturas
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos trajo una presentaci√≥n reveladora de la mano de Juan Jos√© Torres, quien comparti√≥ soluciones concretas para dos desaf√≠os cr√≠ticos que enfrentan las empresas con SAP: la automatizaci√≥n del procesamiento de facturas electr√≥nicas y la contabilidad orientada a unidades de negocio.


El Desaf√≠o de la Facturaci√≥n Electr√≥nica: Volumen Creciente, Tiempo Limitado
Juan Jos√© comenz√≥ con una realidad contundente: los vol√∫menes de facturaci√≥n electr√≥nica est√°n creciendo mes a mes en Paraguay, y la DNIT reporta cifras cada vez m√°s altas de documentos electr√≥nicos aprobados. Esto genera un desaf√≠o operativo significativo para las empresas.
"En pa√≠ses como Chile, si una factura emitida no fue rechazada a las 72 horas, ya empiezan a correr los tiempos de mora. Ac√° todav√≠a no est√° aplicado, pero en cualquier momento se viene."
El problema m√°s com√∫n: contabilidad centraliza las cargas de facturas, muchas veces las deja para los √∫ltimos d√≠as del mes, no se toma el cr√©dito fiscal a tiempo, y se generan problemas para el cierre contable. La soluci√≥n es clara: automatizaci√≥n.

La Soluci√≥n: Automatizaci√≥n Inteligente de Facturas
La propuesta presentada trabaja sobre cualquier versi√≥n de SAP y se basa en tres componentes clave:
Lectura Automatizada

  • Un robot lee los emails con facturas electr√≥nicas
  • Una aplicaci√≥n procesa el QR de la factura paraguaya (trabaja con XML, no con OCR)
  • Se ingresa a SAP a trav√©s de IDOC

Validaciones Inteligentes La soluci√≥n no solo carga facturas, sino que valida:

  • Mapeo autom√°tico del RUC del emisor al c√≥digo de proveedor en SAP
  • Concordancia con √≥rdenes de compra abiertas
  • Lectura del cuerpo del mail para identificar el n√∫mero de orden de compra
  • Determinaci√≥n del centro de costos basado en sucursales
  • Validaci√≥n de condiciones de pago e indicadores de impuestos

Rechazo Autom√°tico Inteligente
Si la factura no cumple con las reglas de negocio (por ejemplo, no declara una orden de compra v√°lida), el sistema la rechaza autom√°ticamente con el listado de √≥rdenes de compra disponibles para que el proveedor reenv√≠e el mail. Esto evita el trabajo manual de an√°lisis y respuesta.
Beneficios Concretos La implementaci√≥n de esta soluci√≥n, que actualmente est√°n desplegando en empresas de Paraguay, genera:

  • Aceleraci√≥n de procesos de cierre contable
  • Descentralizaci√≥n de la carga (log√≠stica puede cargar facturas directamente)
  • Validaci√≥n del CDC en la p√°gina de la DNIT desde la transacci√≥n est√°ndar de SAP
  • Reducci√≥n del papeleo
  • Circuitos de aprobaci√≥n m√°s √°giles

Contabilidad Orientada a Unidades de Negocio: El Ferrari sin Usar
La segunda parte de la presentaci√≥n toc√≥ un punto cr√≠tico que Juan Jos√© identific√≥ en m√∫ltiples implementaciones:
"Cada vez que conozco un cliente nuevo, le pregunto: ¬øCu√°l es tu estado de resultados por marca? ¬øCu√°l es tu margen por marca? Y no lo sabe, o tiene que andar sacando muchos Excel."
El diagn√≥stico es claro: muchas empresas tienen el centro de beneficios mal armado. El centro de beneficios es el dato que consolida todo lo que corresponde al estado de resultados: gastos, ventas y costos directos.

La Propuesta: ROADMAP Analytics
Para resolver esto, la soluci√≥n presentada es Roadmap Analytics, construida sobre SAP Analytics Cloud en entorno S/4HANA:
Concepto Clave
Levanta toda la informaci√≥n del estado de resultados en la memoria de HANA y deriva las dimensiones a partir del documento contable. Es similar al antiguo m√≥dulo COPA (an√°lisis de rentabilidad), pero sin necesidad de crear tablas f√≠sicas nuevas.
Antes vs Ahora

Antes: Crear tablas f√≠sicas en el sistema con caracter√≠sticas e indicadores espec√≠ficos
Ahora: Derivaciones en memoria cuando se levanta el cubo de an√°lisis

Capacidades
An√°lisis Multidimensional: Estado de resultados por cliente, l√≠nea de negocio, sucursal, marca
Planificaci√≥n Consolidada: Integra planificaci√≥n de gastos por centro de costos con planificaci√≥n de ingresos y costos por centro de beneficios
Dashboards Ejecutivos: Desplegables en BTP con an√°lisis de plan vs real
Reportes Descargables: Estados de resultados en Excel con la informaci√≥n consolidada

El Caso Real: Transformaci√≥n en Horas
Juan Jos√© comparti√≥ un ejemplo reciente en Paraguay donde cambiaron la estructura de centros de beneficio de una empresa:
"Ahorramos horas de trabajo de cierre de mes para reportes b√°sicos como la rentabilidad de la empresa por unidad de negocio. No lo ten√≠a cubierto una empresa que tiene SAP hace m√°s de 10 a√±os."

El Mensaje de Fondo

"Muchas veces SAP te da una Ferrari, pero no la usan. Tienen la funcionalidad, pero no la est√°n aprovechando."

La presentaci√≥n dej√≥ en claro que no se trata solo de implementar SAP, sino de aprovechar sus capacidades reales. Ya sea automatizando el procesamiento de facturas electr√≥nicas para responder a los desaf√≠os regulatorios y de volumen, o configurando correctamente los centros de beneficio para tener visibilidad real del negocio.

Ambas soluciones est√°n pensadas para S/4HANA y representan la evoluci√≥n natural de funcionalidades que SAP ha tenido durante a√±os, pero que ahora, con la potencia de HANA y la integraci√≥n con BTP, pueden implementarse de manera m√°s √°gil y efectiva.

¬øTu empresa est√° aprovechando el potencial completo de su inversi√≥n en SAP?

Gracias a Juan Jos√© Torres por compartir su experiencia y conocimiento, y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por crear estos espacios de intercambio. #SITCDE2025

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Transformaci√≥n √Ågil - C√≥mo Acompa√±ar el Cambio en la Era de SAP
entry.content:
Del Control T√©cnico a la Transformaci√≥n √Ågil - C√≥mo Acompa√±ar el Cambio en la Era de SAP
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 cont√≥ con una presentaci√≥n reveladora de Esteban Hartzstein, Director y Fundador de Tebyon Consulting, quien con m√°s de 30 a√±os de experiencia trabajando con SAP, comparti√≥ una reflexi√≥n contundente: existe una enorme brecha entre lo que SAP desarrolla en Alemania y lo que realmente se implementa en Latinoam√©rica.


La Pregunta Inc√≥moda: ¬øSeguimos en 2008?
Reci√©n llegado del ALM Summit 2025 en Alemania, Esteban fue directo: "Hay una desconexi√≥n entre lo que pasa en los product managers que est√°n desarrollando los productos SAP y lo que se termina implementando en las empresas. Seguimos viendo implementaciones que parecen de los a√±os 90."
Los problemas recurrentes:

  • Se implementan como ERPs tradicionales, no se conocen los procesos est√°ndares
  • Demasiados gaps y desarrollos Z sin valor real
  • Falta de metodolog√≠a: "¬øCon Excel y PowerPoint alcanza? No alcanza"
  • Desconocimiento de herramientas como Signavio Process Navigator y Cloud ALM
  • Datos poco limpios, testing deficiente, cutovers problem√°ticos

SAP BTM y SAP ALM: Los Conceptos Clave
SAP Business Transformation Management (BTM) es el enfoque metodol√≥gico que combina cuatro ejes: Estrategia y Valores, Procesos y Arquitectura, Programas y Proyectos, y Personas y Culturas.
SAP Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) gestiona todo el ciclo de vida de las aplicaciones: Implementaci√≥n (Design, Build, Test, Deploy), Operaci√≥n (Detect, Analyze, Correct, Automate), Mejora Continua y Servicios.


La Toolchain Integrada: El Nuevo Paradigma
SAP ha evolucionado de un sistema monol√≠tico a una cadena de herramientas especializadas e integradas:

  • SAP LeanIX: Arquitectura empresarial
  • SAP Signavio: Gesti√≥n de procesos
  • SAP Cloud ALM: Implementaci√≥n y operaciones (el orquestador central)
  • WalkMe/EnableNow: Adopci√≥n digital

SAP Cloud ALM: Gratuito, Potente y Subutilizado
Esteban enfatiz√≥: "Todos los proyectos deber√≠an estar usando Cloud ALM. Es un producto gratuito entregado por SAP, se habilita rapidamente y est√° en la nube."
N√∫meros que impresionan:

  • 2020: 250 clientes
  • 2025: +10,000 clientes proyectados

Capacidades de implementaci√≥n:
Project & Task Management, Process Management, Documentation, Test Orchestration, Test Execution, Deployment Orchestration, Change Enablement.
Capacidades operativas:
Business Process Monitoring con KPIs predefinidos, Job & Automation Monitoring, Integration Monitoring, Health Monitoring, Real User Monitoring, Configuration & Security Analysis - todo con procesamiento inteligente mediante IA (Joule).

Clean Core: Los 5 Principios para Sistemas √Ågiles
SAP Clean Core garantiza que los sistemas se mantengan √°giles y rentables:

  1. Business Processes: Usar est√°ndares sin modificar el core
  2. Extensibility: Desacoplar extensiones (desarrollar en BTP)
  3. Data: Controlar datos seg√∫n √∫ltimos est√°ndares
  4. Integration: Mantener el landscape confiable y flexible
  5. Operations: Operaciones efectivas y eficientes

El Mensaje: Aprovechemos lo que SAP Ya nos Dio
Las recomendaciones finales de Esteban fueron claras:

  • Entiendan los procesos de negocio actuales antes de implementar
  • Planifiquen la arquitectura empresarial
  • Modelen procesos To-Be basados en est√°ndares SAP
  • Usen SAP Activate y trabajen con sprints
  • Aprovechen Cloud ALM gratuito para gesti√≥n de proyectos
  • Operen con monitoreo inteligente
  • Consulten a especialistas - no todas las consultoras tienen el conocimiento necesario

Reflexi√≥n Final
"Cloud ALM lo tienen todos gratuito. Signavio puede ser que tengan alguna versi√≥n incluida. Las herramientas est√°n disponibles, la metodolog√≠a est√° documentada."
La pregunta no es si SAP tiene las herramientas y metodolog√≠as - las tiene, est√°n documentadas y muchas son gratuitas. La pregunta es: ¬øestamos aprovechando todo lo que SAP ha preparado para nosotros, o seguimos implementando como en 2008?
El cambio de era en SAP no es solo tecnol√≥gico - es metodol√≥gico y cultural. Requiere que clientes, consultores y partners demos un paso adelante hacia la verdadera transformaci√≥n empresarial.

Gracias a Esteban Hartzstein y Tebyon Consulting  por compartir su experiencia del ALM Summit 2025 en Alemania, y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay.

entry.title: SAP Champions
entry.content:
Who are SAP Champions?

SAP Champions are:

  • Proactive volunteers with a passion for SAP technologies.
  • Top contributors, leaders, and organizers within the SAP ecosystem.
  • Advocates of SAP communities.
  • Hands-on experts of an SAP product, service, and/or topics.

What do SAP Champions do?

SAP Champions help the SAP Community and its members:

  • Guide and support new members to help them get the most out of their community experience.
  • Share insights and expertise via blog posts, answering questions, drive or contribute to SAP Community group discussions.
  • Lead local SAP Community driven events such as an informal meetup or SAP Inside Track.

What is the difference between the SAP Champions and SAP Mentors programs?

The SAP Mentors share their knowledge and experience to SAP executives and product teams.
This provides an outside -> in view.
The SAP Champions advocate for SAP and SAP Community. They support us to share key messaging and to help drive software adoption in their networks.
This provides an inside -> out view.

Contact us

Looking for more information? For questions and comments about the SAP Champions, please contact sapchampions@sap.com.

Submit a nomination

SAP Champions can be nominated or self-nominated.
Nominated can include being approached proactively by the Community Programs team.
The selection process takes place by the community team, in cycles.

For more information, please contact sapchampions@sap.com.

What makes a great SAP Champion?

  • Top contributor: SAP Champions are top contributors to the SAP Community and ecosystem, serving as distinguished leaders and upholding community ideals and spirit. Traits include being a top influencer, leader, and organizer.
  • Advocate: Advocates and representatives of SAP communities ‚Äì whether through community.sap.com, related sites, social media, or in-person events. They demonstrate passion in everything they do, and inspire others to be like them.
  • Active SAP Community member: Must be a member of SAP Community for a minimum of one full year with an active membership, a profile with a recognizable display name, and featuring a photo.
    Have a robust reputation across SAP Community, including active participation in SAP Community groups (including location groups), questions and answers, blog posts and comments, and events.
  • Expert: Hands-on experts of an SAP product(s), service(s), and/or topic(s).
  • Professional: The span of membership must be marked with positive behavior and adherence to the community rules of engagement. The member's interactions with others must always be polite, friendly, and supportive; this extends to social media and both virtual and in-person events.
  • Continuous Learner: Someone who stays up-to-date and innovates.
  • Events-driven: Due to our renewed focus on events, in the previous one-year period, the member should have participated in several events including both online and in-person ‚Äì this includes hosting/speaking/attending.
  • Well-connected: Have a strong network and reputation across external sites/channels ‚Äì for example, LinkedIn.
  • Eligibility: Anyone not employed by an SAP competitor is eligible for the SAP Champions program. SAP Champions, however, may not be a member of an existing influencer program (e.g., SAP Mentors) or a special council dedicated to community strategy or activity.

Further resources

  • Current SAP Champions ‚Äì meet our amazing community leaders!
  • Become an Event Organizer ‚Äì for those interested, this guide is useful for those with a passion for proactively nurturing a local community.

entry.title: SAP Developer News 20th November 2025
entry.content:
ITEMS

Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Singapore  

  • SAP Teched home https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html  

CAP ‚Äì Advanced Event Mesh plugin 

  • @cap-js/advanced-event-mesh plugin https://github.com/cap-js/advanced-event-mesh 
  • CAP Plugin for SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-integration-suite/advanced-event-mesh/cap-plugin-for-sap-integration-suite-advanced-event-mesh 

UKISUG Connect 2025 

  • Event website https://www.ukisugconnect.co.uk/ 
  • Agenda https://virtual.oxfordabstracts.com/event/75555/program  

SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Release 2511 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-btp-abap-environment-release-2511/ba-p/14257787 

Devtoberfest 2024 winner interviews at SAP TechEd 2025 ‚Äì Michael Teti 

  • Devtoberfest details https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-welcome/ba-p/14182817  

CHAPTER TITLES

0:00 Intro 
0:07 Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Singapore 
0:50 CAP ‚Äì Advanced Event Mesh plugin 
1:21 UKISUG Connect 2025 
2:45 SAP BTP ABAP Environment ‚Äì Release 2511 
4:00 Devtoberfest 2024 winner interviews at SAP TechEd 2025 ‚Äì Michael Teti 

TRANSCRIPT

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for November 20th, 2025.

[Tom] Hey, everybody. Welcome from the TechEd on Tour. We're here in Singapore today for a CodeJam, our second to last stop on the TechEd on Tour. Next week, we'll be in Bangalore for the big TechEd event there. Everybody looking forward to that? Yeah. Yeah. Yeah, right now we're here in the SAP offices of Singapore. And if you see behind us, there is Ella, the robotic barista, making Rich a hot chocolate right now. So we're enjoying the comforts of the SAP office and looking forward to seeing everybody in Bangalore next week. So until then, we'll see you there. See you there. Bye. Bye.

[Antonio] Hola, SAP developers. In case you missed it, there is a new CAP plugin in town. the Advanced Event Mesh Plugin. You can leverage this new plugin to easily connect your CAP application with SAP Integration Suite Advanced Event Mesh and start publishing or consuming events. Check out the plugin documentation to find out more about how to set up this plugin. I'm including the links in the description. Happy eventing!

[DJ] The conference season is very much in full swing, keeping us developer advocates busy. From organizing and running Devtoberfest through giving the Developer Keynote and running the Developer Garage at TechEd in Berlin and lots more and now many of the team are playing a major role in the On Tour part of the event with a stop in Sydney one in Melbourne and now as you've seen from an earlier item in this very news episode one in Singapore on their way to Bangalore. Over on this side of the world we have coming up the SAP UK and Ireland user group conference Connect. It's a great event it's happening from Sunday the 30th of November through Tuesday the 2nd of December that's right It's like a family reunion lots of discussions take place learning is shared and friendships are made. I'm very honored to be there, I'm running two sessions a hands-on workshop on modeling with CAP's CDS and also a tech talk on local first development with CAP. If you're attending Connect, come along and say hello in fact come to the sessions - the only thing you need to bring is your curiosity. See you there!

[Mamikee] The latest SAP BTP ABAP Environment release 25.11 is here, and it has been available since November 15th. And it's packed with upgrades across ADT, RAP, Fiori, business configuration, integration, and more. So here's a few highlights you don't want to miss. First, big feature drops across the tooling. In ADT, you now get Ghost Text Keyword Completion as the new default. A new editor for email templates. You can create custom email templates using the Maintain Email Template apps and full business configuration set editing right inside ADT. Plus, macOS users, the graphical call timeline for ABAP traces is now supported. In RAP, you can now log base change documents as business events using the new syntax to READ ENTITY, with changes to inspect change operation and define global side effects that refresh UI properties automatically with a single keystroke. Now, this was only a handful of updates. For the full list of updates, read the blog post in the description below.

[Anja & Michael] Welcome here in Berlin TechEd 2025 on site it's so great we handed over from the Devtoberfest now we're here and a lot of TechEd tour stops will join. I'm very happy to have you here, I know that you joined the Devtoberfest and not just joining you did win the Devtoberfest. It's so amazing so what was your experience what did you like, what was your highlight of that? Devtoberfest was incredible. The opportunity to experience the different areas of SAP and to become exposed to those areas was incredible. Having a focus on web technologies, but being exposed to the other services that I was not exposed to prior was very eye-opening and made me a really deep, deep dive into those areas. So I was able to draw some insights that I could reflect back into my work at my work camp. And that's great and now being here on site being on TechEd so what did you ... was thinking or wishing for and what is your highlight here? Oh I was wishing for more and I got more more than that um it was really incredible because it was non -stop sessions um hands-on road mapping um in so many different areas it was uh morning to evening of of of consuming information that I can take back and be empowered with. So I'm very excited to go back and share what I've learned this week. Thank you so much. Thank you.

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: SPAIDER Revolucionando Procesos con Inteligencia Artificial
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay #SITCDE2025 nos regal√≥ una charla fascinante de la mano de Douglas Figueiredo, Socio y CTO de TEIA Connect, @Teia_Connect quien con m√°s de 18 a√±os de experiencia en proyectos SAP, nos present√≥ SPAIDER: una soluci√≥n que est√° revolucionando la manera en que las empresas interact√∫an con sus sistemas mediante inteligencia artificial



Douglas comparti√≥ una visi√≥n clara: la inteligencia artificial debe generar valor real en el mundo empresarial. SPAIDER se enfoca en empoderar al usuario final para que ejecute actividades repetitivas y complejas usando simplemente lenguaje natural.

"La persona m√°s importante en el sistema es el usuario final, y necesitamos darle autonom√≠a para que pueda hacer sus actividades utilizando los motores de inteligencia artificial."

¬øQu√© es SPAIDER?
SPAIDER (SAP Process Artificial Intelligence Evolution Resolution) es un asistente virtual que conecta usuarios con sistemas SAP. El nombre fusiona ingeniosamente Teia (telara√±a en portugu√©s) con Spider (ara√±a en ingl√©s), representando c√≥mo esta soluci√≥n conecta todos los elementos del ecosistema empresarial a trav√©s de un chat intuitivo.


Los Cuatro Pilares de SPAIDER
SPAIDER-eDOCS: Gestiona autom√°ticamente documentos fiscales electr√≥nicos, emitiendo m√°s de 30 tipos de documentos obligatorios, consultando XMLs y optimizando aprobaciones gubernamentales.
SPAIDER-MONI: Monitoreo inteligente que supervisa aspectos t√©cnicos y de negocio, alertando proactivamente sobre problemas antes de que impacten las operaciones.
SPAIDER-ESPEC: Genera especificaciones funcionales y prototipos mediante conversaci√≥n natural, permitiendo que cualquier usuario documente requisitos sin conocimientos t√©cnicos.
SPAIDER-TEST: Automatiza pruebas de regresi√≥n, ejecutando procesos completos y comparando valores con precisi√≥n del 100%. Genera evidencias en PDF para validaci√≥n de cambios.



Durante la presentaci√≥n, Douglas mostr√≥ el poder del lenguaje natural con SPAIDER-TEST. Con un simple comando como "crear un pedido de venta normal", el sistema identifica el tipo de pedido, consulta la referencia, crea autom√°ticamente todo el proceso (pedido, entrega, factura) y presenta los resultados de forma clara.
Cuando modific√≥ intencionalmente un dato de material para simular un impacto fiscal, SPAIDER-TEST detect√≥ autom√°ticamente las diferencias, las cuantific√≥ con precisi√≥n y gener√≥ un reporte comparativo. Todo esto sin escribir c√≥digo ni navegar por m√∫ltiples transacciones SAP.


La Visi√≥n de Teia Connect
Lo m√°s inspirador fue entender la filosof√≠a de Teia Connect sobre IA: no reemplazar personas, sino empoderarlas. En Teia, todos utilizan IA diariamente, los candidatos deben demostrar c√≥mo la usan, y cada producto se construye con esta tecnolog√≠a. Como Douglas enfatiz√≥: "La integraci√≥n debe ser transparente para el usuario, sin necesidad de mirar m√∫ltiples transacciones."
El Mensaje Final
SPAIDER representa un cambio fundamental en la interacci√≥n con sistemas empresariales: democratizar el acceso para que cualquier usuario ejecute procesos complejos, liberar tiempo estrat√©gico automatizando tareas repetitivas, y generar valor real usando IA para resolver problemas concretos de negocio.
¬øLo mejor? SPAIDER es modular y escalable, adapt√°ndose a las necesidades espec√≠ficas de cada empresa.

Un especial agradecimiento a Douglas Figueiredo por compartir su conocimiento y pasi√≥n por la innovaci√≥n, demostrando c√≥mo la inteligencia artificial puede transformar realmente los procesos empresariales. A Teia Connect por desarrollar soluciones que empoderan a los usuarios y generan valor tangible en el ecosistema SAP.

Gracias tambi√©n al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por hacer posible estos espacios de aprendizaje que fortalecen nuestra comunidad y nos mantienen a la vanguardia de la tecnolog√≠a.

entry.title: Blog it Forward - Mino Kato
entry.content:
(The Japanese version follows the English text.) ‚ÄªÊó•Êú¨Ë™ûÁâà„ÅØËã±Ë™û„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„Å®„Å´Á∂ö„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

Introduction

Hello everyone! I received the "Blog it Forward" baton from @sumikko , who organizes community with me, and I am writing this post now. Thank you, Sumikko-san, for this great opportunity! You can read Sumikko-san's post [here] and learn more about the BIF challenge [here].

About Me

My name is Mino Kato. Since "Mino" is a rare name in Japan, people usually call me by my first name rather than a nickname.

I have been working as an SAP consultant in the accounting area for many years. Recently, I have been focusing on projects involving S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (now SAP Cloud ERP), specifically sticking to the "Fit to Standard" approach. I am also an organizer for chillSAP, a local SAP community in Japan, along with Sumikko-san.

Although I am not a developer myself, I love catching up on BTP extension-related and AI-related knowledge that helps users utilize the system more conveniently. This passion motivates my community activities and my multiple participations in SAP TechEd.

My Encounter with SAP

I joined an IT company as a new graduate. After training, the first project I was assigned to along with several colleagues was already in trouble, and we were thrown in as testing personnel. While the business trips and the relationships with the people I worked with are good memories, I suddenly experienced the difficulty of building a system from scratch (or rather, the chaos involving many people when things go wrong).

So, when that project ended and I was given the choice, "Do you want to be involved in Web development or ERP projects next?", I chose ERP without hesitation and went to receive SAP training.

When I saw the SAP system screen (GUI at the time) for the first time, my impression was: "Wow! The buttons are so detailed, and their shapes are perfectly aligned!"

It might sound funny now, but after seeing the chaos, I was moved by the order. Of course, I now know that ERP projects are also difficult and have their own challenges...

Participating in SAP TechEd

Under the mission of "Let's catch up on SAP's new technologies and think of new services" at the company I belonged to at the time, I participated in SAP TechEd for the first time in 2018. I had participated in SAP Inside Track Tokyo in Japan before and felt that TechEd would be interesting. Actually participating, I was able to feel the passion of global engineers and participants from Japan. I thought, "Ah, I love places where we can have these kinds of conversations," which became the trigger for me to actively involve myself in community activities.

Photo from a past TechEd FunRun. I loved these kinds of events too!

Encounter with the Community

During the "Japan Night" at TechEd, I was scouted to speak at SAP Inside Track Tokyo, and presenting on the theme of Design Thinking was a very good experience. I originally loved listening to other people's presentations, but participating as a speaker was an experience that broke down a wall for me. Since that presentation, I think I have become able to jump into various places with lighter footwork.

Long ago, when I started touching SAP, if I ran into something I didn't understand in the finance module, I could only ask seniors at my company or guess the mechanism from SAP Notes information. But now, compared to before, help documents and KBAs are substantial, and we can gain various insights through QA or Blogs in the global community.

And furthermore, it is very stimulating and happy if I can read it in Japanese... Based on such motivation, the SAP Advent Calendar, LT (Lightning Talk) event, and various events of the community "chillSAP" started.

My Favorite Things (Fun Facts)

I love going to the theater. My eyes are glued to living humans unfolding action such as dancing and sword fighting right in front of me. I go to watch ballet, musicals, popular theater, and "2.5-dimensional" plays quite often recently. The opera I watched in between TechEd Berlin the other day was also wonderful. After the pandemic, my spirit of "Let's watch what I want to see live while I can!" has spurred on. I get energy from the stage and turn it into vitality for my daily life.

Sitting in a chair for a long time for theatergoing is bad for the body, but I think doing Yoga regularly helps with that. I like "Ashtanga Yoga," which is quite hard for yoga.

Photo with my teacher Cathy from Hawaii, who I took online classes with during the pandemic, when she came to Japan. (For some reason, she took photos in 3 patterns: vertical, horizontal, and diagonal. This is the diagonal version!)

Answers to BIF Questions

1. If you were 20 again, what would you study?

I might try to get a degree in accounting and get closer to a CPA qualification. In promoting "Fit to Standard," I sometimes feel that having a qualification is easy to understand to be recognized as a specialist in the accounting area. However, learning it after becoming a working adult competes with too many other things I want to learn (English, other foreign languages, SAP and AI technology catch-up), so... But I have no regrets about proceeding to the path of IT by becoming interested in computers while doing experiments and programming in the science department. If I had proceeded to the path of accounting, there is a high possibility that I would not be doing my current job, so I feel it is asking for the moon after all. I will continue to study accounting within the range I can now.

2. What is the most important thing you learned from your parents?

Rather than "learned," it is what they "gave" me. They gave me many books since I was a child, and perhaps due to my original preference, I grew up to be a book lover, which I think is my asset now. I loved experiencing different worlds through picture books and children's books. As I grew up, I read many books including manga, and I was able to know various ways of life and ways of thinking. Being a book lover is also useful when learning new technologies and knowledge now. I love the feeling of my world expanding.

Closing

Thank you for reading this far. Next, I would like to pass the baton to @MikuKawanabe. She is running JSUG's Next Gen Boost community, and I am always stimulated by her powerful activities! I definitely want to know the secret of that energy.

entry.title: SAP Community Hobbies Series: One step after the other - Long-distance hiking
entry.content:
From one extreme hobby to another: While rileyrainey enjoys jumping down from huge heights, I love hiking the extra mile. Or better said: hiking over thousands of kilometers, one day after another, one step at a time. I am happy to take on the baton in the SAP  Community Hobbies series and introduce my passion of long-distance hiking to you. 

Who I am?

Hi! I am Jan Rumig from Germany, a Chief Development Architect in the SAP Business Technology Platform. As a contrast to my daily office hours, I spend most of my leisure time with hiking, reading about hiking and taking pictures of our beautiful nature while hiking. One could say I breathe hiking. Since recently, I also found passion in standing in front of big audiences and talk about my adventures.

How my love for hiking began

I wasn‚Äôt even born yet when my parents first took me to the mountains. It all began back then in Ramsau am Dachstein, where I spent several weeks each year with my family. During my teenage years, I went on my first solo hikes there. Later, as a young adult, I started to intensify this passion - spending one or two weeks a year in mountain regions, always with a fixed base. At that time, I already had the desire to explore new and more distant regions, but often I lacked hiking companions, and I didn‚Äôt quite have the courage to set out on my own.

First Solo Adventures: Portugal, the Balkans, and Beyond

Everything changed after a painful breakup. From that moment on, there was no holding back. My first solo hike took me to the Rota Vicentina, the Fishermen‚Äôs Trail in Portugal - one of the most beautiful coastal hikes in the world. Many more regions followed: Serbia, Romania, Ukraine, the Peaks of the Balkans Trail, Colombia, and several others. I was infected with hiking fever. The more I saw and experienced, the more I wanted to discover. Between trips to faraway countries, I explored the Alps. And even on weekends, I felt the urge to head outdoors. Luckily, I live close to wonderful hiking regions - the Odenwald, the Palatinate, or the Black Forest are my weekly playgrounds.

üéßSome details of the Peaks of the Balkans, I discussed in a podcast, in German only: Wanderwach & Kaffee.

Beautiful coastline on the Rota Vicentina

Gjeravica, highest mountain of Cosovo

Inspiration from New Zealand: Te Araroa

But deep down, I had always carried an unfulfilled desire to experience a truly long and demanding adventure. At first, my own inner doubts held me back: You won‚Äôt manage this, something could happen to you‚Ä¶ You can still do such an adventure at a later point in time. Then, in 2022, two colleagues of mine passed away unexpectedly. It was a harsh reminder not to postpone life. I asked my boss whether I could take six months off. Luckily, I had accumulated 162 vacation days over the years. My leave was approved. Some years earlier, I had heard of the Te Araroa in New Zealand - 3,000 km through breathtaking landscapes. So, over the turn of the year 2023/2024, I set off for New Zealand. The Te Araroa is considered one of the toughest long-distance trails in the world - and for good reason. While it is fully marked, it often leads through pathless terrain. In total, I had to ford around 100 rivers, some of them chest-deep. Much of the forest felt like jungle, and the ‚Äútrail‚Äù was often nothing more than a mudfest. Yet, perhaps because of these challenges, it became an unforgettable experience that profoundly changed me and my outlook on life. And ‚Äúunfortunately,‚Äù it also sparked an insatiable appetite for long-distance hiking and adventure. I decided then and there to take more extended breaks in the future, balancing my career with my passion for the outdoors.

üéßPodcast epiode about all the details of my hike through New Zealand, in German only: Holy Sheep Neuseeland. 

Typical New Zealand forestSunrise over the Richmond RangesJan above Lake ConstanceRainbow over mountain hutEnd of Te Araroa trail in Bluff

Discovering my homeland

No sooner had one adventure ended than I wanted to plan the next. But after those long-haul flights to New Zealand, I didn‚Äôt want to put such a strain on the environment again. That‚Äôs when everything came together: during my trek in New Zealand, I listened to a podcast where Soulboy spoke about the creation of the North South Trail (NST). From that moment, a seed was planted: Wouldn‚Äôt it be wonderful to explore my own homeland on foot? Many of the trails that make up the NST had already been on my personal wish list for some time. And while on the Te Araroa I was just one of about 4,000 hikers per year, only around 30 verified hikers had completed the NST in its entirety so far. So, my decision was clear: in 2025, I would set out to hike the NST.
What were my expectations for the trail? I was well aware that the wilderness experience of New Zealand couldn‚Äôt be replicated in Germany - and I wasn‚Äôt looking for that. Instead, I wanted to get to know my homeland step by step, meter by meter, discovering its many facets from north to south. A few examples: the landscape begins flat as a pancake in the north and gradually grows more mountainous as you move south. Or take food: up north it‚Äôs Mettbr√∂tchen for breakfast or giant Rumkugeln from the bakery, in the Palatinate it‚Äôs Saumagen, and in the south you‚Äôre rewarded with Kaiserschmarrn. And I was eager to explore regions I‚Äôd never visited before, many of which had long been on my list. On its 3,700 kilometers, the North South Trail connects 36 certified trails leading through 30 national parks.
People often ask me which parts of the North South Trail were my favorites. Uff, that‚Äôs a tough question. Every region has something exciting to offer, and I honestly can‚Äôt narrow it down to just one. The Saar-Hunsr√ºck-Steig fascinated me because it‚Äôs so diverse and offers a little bit of everything: narrow singletracks, streams, beautiful forests, castles, and more. The Palatinate Wine Trail felt special because it‚Äôs close to my home, so I felt a sense of familiarity there - and the Palatinate people are simply warm-hearted folks. Even in the Black Forest, where I had plenty of bad weather, there were memorable sections - especially the famous Schluchtensteig. But if I had to pick what touched me the most, it‚Äôs always the high mountains. That‚Äôs why the Nagelfluhkette near the end of the trail truly stole my heart.

üéßSome stories and more details of my walk through Germany can be found in this podcast episode, in German only: Off the Path.

Deer under treesRed KitePalatinate forestMountain in cloudsJan above Oberstdorf valleyMost southern point of Germany: Haldenwanger Eck

 

What is so fascinating in long-distance hiking

As I indicated already before, I love being outdoors, experiencing all sensory impulses from nature and watching and photographing all the beauty out there. But these reasons are not specific to long-distance hiking. What makes long distances special: you have to carry all your stuff on your back, most of the times including a tent and cooking equipment. On my hike through Germany I carried a total weight of around 18 kg without water. While hiking, you reduce yourself to the most minimal needs. As a famous female German hiker, Christine Th√ºrmer, says: every day you only focus on walk, sleep, eat, repeat. If you then get a shower after several days or you buy a chocolate bar, these small things make you really, really happy.

üéß More details about the fascination of long-distance hiking, I discussed in a podcast episode, in German only: Frei Raus. 

All my stuff for a long distance hike

Special support: Trail Angels üëº

Have you ever heard about trail angels? For long-distance hikers these are true angels. These are usually private individuals that support hikers along the trail with free food or a chance for an overnight sleeping opportunity. On my trip through Germany, I stayed at 25 trail angels. Most of these stays were much better than any hotel. Sometimes there was a delicious dinner, a free bed and a rich breakfast. As most of them are also outdoorsy, I got new inspirations for future adventures. These encounters with foreign people is exactly what's missing in today's world: love towards humans that you don't know.

Reaching the final signpost

Although I enjoy every minute of my walks, it is such a wonderful feeling when you reach the final signpost at the end of your long trail. All the tension falls apart and you feel deeply relieved. I am always really proud of what I achieved with my body. Our body is the most fascinating thing. Once accommodated, it carries you everywhere like a machine. We have to cherish all of it and take care about our health. My proudest moment so far was achieving the North South Trail in Fastest known time. For the 3,700 km I only needed 96 hiking days + 2 rest days.

Everybody can do it

You have doubts if you can do the same? Don't worry. The good news is: you can. Before you start on a long hike, do some test hikes. First maybe start with a single days, then a weekender, followed by multiple days. If you feel comfortable, go for something longer. And when the day comes, the important thing is, start slowly and give your body the time it needs to accommodate to the efforts. Day by day you will feel getting stronger and more endurable. The worst thing you can do is to never start. Always remember that our life is limited. Better regret the things you've done than the things you haven't done. 

What will be next?

So, am I done with long-distance hiking now? Absolutely not - quite the opposite. The big question is simply: what‚Äôs next? For now, I think I‚Äôll choose something a little shorter. Current favorites include the High Scardus Trail through North Macedonia, Kosovo, and Albania, the Lycian Way in Turkey, or perhaps the GR20 on Corsica as an add-on. But who knows - maybe something entirely different will come my way.
Besides hiking, I discovered another related hobby: talking about my adventures. So I take my pictures and videos, convert them into visually attractive multi-vision shows, add stories and present them in front of big audiences. Let's connect if you see a chance for me to present my adventures somewhere close by to you. üòä

üéü  For readers based in Germany around Heidelberg, there is the perfect opportunity to listen first-hand about my hike through New Zealand, I will be a speaker at the wonderful Wunderwelten Festival on January 3rd.  

One of my talks about the hike through New Zealand

 

Want to know more?

You also want to start hiking? There are a lot of outdoor portals where you can easily find beautiful hikes around the place where you live. Just search for tours in your region in your favorite search engine. Additionally, contact me, I might have some proposals. üòá

You became curious to learn more about my hikes?

  • You find a lot of pictures and daily reports of my travels on my Instagram account. 
  • You can access all my hikes on Komoot.

Coming up next

I am happy to pass the baton to Marika who is introducing her hobbies singing and theatre to us. In addition she engages in meaningful volunteer work. Stay tuned!

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: SAP BTP y Estrategias de Migraci√≥n a SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos regal√≥ una jornada t√©cnica excepcional de la mano de Juan Pablo Barril, Experto SAP BASIS & BTP y RISE Cloud Architecture de @Kuaa_Technology Kuaatec, quien nos gui√≥ a trav√©s de dos pilares fundamentales de la transformaci√≥n digital empresarial: SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) y las estrategias de migraci√≥n a SAP S/4HANA.


SAP Business Technology Platform: Conectar e Innovar
¬øQu√© necesitan las organizaciones ganadoras?
Las empresas buscan agilidad e innovaci√≥n para competir, transformarse y prosperar:

  • Reaccionar r√°pidamente a los cambios del mercado
  • Lograr resultados excepcionales y avances innovadores
  • Diferenciarse de la competencia
  • Capacidad de conectar aplicaciones, procesos y datos dispares

Las Tres √Åreas de SAP BTP
1. App Dev & Automation
Experiencia low-code/no-code y herramientas pro-code
Automatizaci√≥n rob√≥tica de procesos
Gesti√≥n del flujo de trabajo

2. Data & Analytics
Productos de datos listos para la empresa
Toma de decisiones aumentada por IA
Plataforma de datos abiertos

3. Integration
3,800+ integraciones preconstruidas
4,400+ APIs y gr√°ficos de datos
Integraci√≥n de procesos E2E para soluciones SAP y no-SAP

Como mencion√≥ Juan Pablo: "Estos proyectos de BTP son altamente muy r√°pidos, son proyectos cortos de dos, tres meses y las empresas necesitan esos cambios inmediatos."

SAP Build: La Soluci√≥n Unificada
SAP Build Apps

  • Funciones visuales en la nube para aplicaciones de pila completa
  • Desarrollo colaborativo entre negocio y desarrolladores
  • Soporte multicanal para m√≥viles y web
  • Integraci√≥n v√≠a API REST y OData

SAP Build Process Automation

  • Flujos de trabajo con arrastrar y soltar
  • Soluciones predise√±adas
  • IA incorporada para generaci√≥n de procesos

Durante la presentaci√≥n mostr√≥ un ejemplo de Purchase Requisition Approval, donde Joule ayuda a generar el requisition y crea autom√°ticamente el flujo de trabajo completo.

Joule Studio
Permite crear agentes de IA personalizados:

  • Comprenden y resuelven problemas comerciales espec√≠ficos
  • Experiencia conversacional unificada
  • Seguridad integrada de nivel empresarial

¬øPor D√≥nde Empezar?
Juan Pablo comparti√≥ recursos clave:

  • SAP BTP Guidance Framework: Gu√≠as de decisi√≥n, arquitecturas de referencia y mejores pr√°cticas
  • SAP Discovery Center: Casos de uso, historias de clientes y estimador de costos
  • SAP Learning: M√°s de 100 SAP Learning Journeys gratuitos
  • Free Tier and Trial: Probar SAP BTP sin costo inicial

"BTP se puede usar much√≠simo... todo esto se puede tambi√©n utilizar con una cuenta free trial. No te requiere hardware, lo √∫nico que vas a tener que instalar es un cloud connector."

Estrategias de Migraci√≥n a SAP S/4HANA
Brownfield vs Greenfield
Brownfield (Conversi√≥n de Sistema)

  • Conversi√≥n t√©cnica completa de SAP ERP existente a S/4HANA
  • Utilizar tecnolog√≠a e instalaciones existentes
  • Comenzar r√°pidamente
  • Menor riesgo

Greenfield (Nueva Implementaci√≥n)

  • Reingenier√≠a y simplificaci√≥n de procesos
  • Elegir nueva tecnolog√≠a
  • Realizar carga de datos inicial
  • Mayor planificaci√≥n inicial

SAP Readiness Check: El Punto de Partida
Juan Pablo explic√≥ que esta herramienta indica qu√© tan preparado est√° el sistema para migrar a S/4HANA, analizando:

  • Compatibilidad t√©cnica (versi√≥n, add-ons, extensiones)
  • C√≥digo ABAP y funciones obsoletas
  • Rendimiento y dimensionamiento
  • Procesos de negocio y oportunidades de mejora
  • Recomendaciones Fiori

"Se hace siempre previo a hacer las conversiones para tener una hoja de ruta real de c√≥mo estamos parados hoy d√≠a del sistema y todos los ajustes que hay que hacer."

SAP Simplification Check
Muestra qu√© cambios concretos hacer en procesos, datos y funciones:
Verificaci√≥n de Relevancia

Identifica qu√© Simplification Items aplican
Dimensiona el impacto funcional y t√©cnico

Verificaci√≥n de Consistencia

  • Comprueba que datos y procesos cumplan las nuevas estructuras
  • Detecta inconsistencias antes de la conversi√≥n

Conversi√≥n de Sistema: Fases Principales
Fase de Preparaci√≥n:

  • Requerimientos del sistema
  • Maintenance Planner
  • Pre checks
  • Custom code preparation
  • Unicode conversion, OS & DB Version, SPAM Version

Fase de Realizaci√≥n:

  • SUM (Software Update Manager)
  • Migraci√≥n DB
  • Software Update
  • Data Conversion

"Es important√≠simo actualizar la SPAM. Es muy important√≠simo porque las empresas vienen de sistemas viejos y tenemos que validar las versiones compatibles de base de datos y sistema operativo."

El Desaf√≠o del C√≥digo Custom
Juan Pablo fue claro sobre el mayor desaf√≠o:
"La tarea m√°s ardua es todos los reportes que vamos a ver... la idea de SAP en la conversi√≥n es limpiar y tratar de minimizar al m√≠nimo el tema de los desarrollos."
"Hay que analizar si esas aplicaciones llevarlas a c√≥digo en BTP o directamente reemplazarla. Porque en muchos casos hay esa funcionalidad, alguien desarroll√≥ algo y hoy d√≠a est√° disponible en las aplicaciones est√°ndar."


Agradecemos a Kuaa technology por su patrocinio del SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025, haciendo posible estos espacios de aprendizaje en la comunidad SAP.
Un agradecimiento especial a Juan Pablo Barril por compartir su conocimiento t√©cnico sobre SAP BTP y las estrategias de migraci√≥n a S/4HANA de manera clara y pr√°ctica.
¬°Gracias al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay!

entry.title: SAP Q4 first meetup highlights
entry.content:
This is the last quarter of the year 2025. We organized another SAP event for the Columbus location. This event became special because of two things. First, a few new members joined the event online on Google Meet, and second, we plan to organize SAP Inside Track at the Columbus location. New members who joined the event for the first time are Pavan Sarda, Sumit Maloo and Vishal Gupta. They all introduced themselves, their experience, type of industry experience etc.

 

We got very good inputs for organizing the SAP Inside Track. Suggestions were given to organize the following events: speaker, workshops, tea, and lunch. Topics can be related to the latest innovations in SAP S4HANA, industry-specific knowledge, Role of artificial intelligence in industry. Workshops can be conducted on introducing SAP S4HANA knowledge in the education system.

The next plan of action will be to contact SAP Germany and share the plan and arrange the approval to organize the event.

entry.title: When Physical Identity Turns Digital: Rethinking Traceability in Enterprise Integration
entry.content:
Modern large scale integration architectures are powered by advance resurgence of observability, distributed tracing, and correlations.
The advancement in observability and analytics platform, provides confidence to extend the reach of integration and envision more on horizon.

The traceability improvement is not limited to the digital world.
The evolutionary spiral is expanding in the realms of supply chain operations, infobahn and data reservoirs.

With EPCIS(Electronic Product Code Information Services) upgrade to version 2.0, the business events, propagating downstream, upstream or in the reverse logistic channel- can be wrapped in json-ld/json file and can be upserted at each stage of the supply chain to the next.

Key EPC identifiers are GTIN, SGTIN(Combination of serial number and GTIN), GRAI(Global Returnable Asset Identifier) and SSCC(Serial Shipping Container Code).

The core idea of this blog is to use the physical EPC(Electronic Product Code) identifiers as W3C trace context identifiers such as traceparent and tracestate.
Each integrated (and OTEL observable) cloud/web application , in case forwards, these identifiers from one system to other, as part of HTTP headers then the organizations can establish strong correlation between physical supply chain events and digital system interactions. A major leverage point of these headers, would be the scenarios, where asynchronous request and response is used at larger scale for e.g. usage of SAP Event Mesh, JMS Queues etc.

For supply-chain leaders and digital-transformation executives, the multi-fold benefits are clear:
a unified, correlated view of physical events and digital flows, enabling deeper insights, quicker decisions, and more successful operations. From a different vantage point, the digital trails set by W3C trace context, reflects the recording of physical events by the digital systems as traceparent/tracestate, whenever the system digitally observes a product related event(specified by EPCIS jason-ld file) passing through it.

Following are few methods to set/derive the W3C trace context using epc ids:
- Set traceparent as hash of epc id.
- Set tracestate as epc id.
- Set trace-id field of traceparent as epc id(if epc id is a UUID).

Below you would find an http client snippet which performs the above suggested steps.  The snippet below is only for didactic purpose.

with open("epcis_payload.json", "r", encoding="utf-8") as file:
    payload = json.load(file)

#epcis file itself can carry traceparent as part of extension field; if present extract and set it 
traceParent = None
if 'extension' in payload:
    if 'traceContext' in payload['extension']:
        if 'traceparent' in payload['extension']['traceContext']:
            traceParent = payload['extension']['traceContext']['traceparent']

#Otherwise, hash the epc id and set traceparent with the obtained value post hashing             
if traceParent == None:            
    # Create deterministic 16 byte trace ID
    if 'epcList' in payload:
        traceId = hashlib.sha256(str(payload['epcList']).encode()).hexdigest()[:32]
    else:
        traceId = str(uuid.uuid4())[:32]
    span_uuid = uuid.uuid4()
    spanId = str(span_uuid)
    #traceparent = 00-<trace-id>-<span-id>-01
    traceParent = '00-' + traceId + '-' + spanId[:16] + '-01'

#Add traceparent as http header 
headers.update({"traceparent": traceParent})

#epcis file itself can carry tracestate as part of extension field; if present extract and set it
traceState = ""
if 'extension' in payload:
    if 'traceContext' in payload['extension']:
        if 'traceState' in payload['extension']['traceContext']:
            traceState = payload['extension']['traceContext']['traceState']

#Otherwise, set the tracestate as epc id           
if traceState == "":
        if 'epcList' in payload: 
            # Create tracestate from EPCIS Id
            traceState = 'epcList = ' + str(payload['epcList'])
        if 'inputEPCList' in payload:
            # Extend the tracestate
            if 'epcList' in traceState:
                traceState = traceState + ',' + 'inputEPCList = ' + str(payload['inputEPCList'])
            else:
                traceState = 'inputEPCList = ' + str(payload['inputEPCList'])
        if 'outputEPCList' in payload:
            traceState = traceState + ',' + 'outputEPCList = ' + str(payload['outputEPCList'])

#Add tracestate as http header 
headers.update({"tracestate": traceState})

#POST request
response = requests.post(url, auth=HTTPBasicAuth(username, password), headers=headers, json=payload)

The EPCIS json-ld/json file forwarder, can even send traceparent and tracestate(as part of extension field of the file) along with business event details.

In the Runtime Configuration of Integration Flow, set traceparent and tracestate as allowed headers (as shown below):

One can even think of embedding the returned MPL ID (from SAP Integration Suite. as part of HTTP response), into tracestate for further transmission down the lane. Later, the predecessor MPL IDs and Integration Flows involved, in processing, the EPCIS json-Ld, can be determined as per explanation in following help documentation:
https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/using-ids-to-filter-messages?locale=en-US&q=predecessor

An EPCIS event describes what, where, why, when and how about the business event. Taking an abstract look to overall above suggested scheme-  it would appear as if a new dimension is added to EPCIS event i.e. who(digitally viewed the event).


Now imagine that the integrated systems are streaming these message headers to data lake such as SAP Business Data Cloud or to a data federation system. This would then open a new portal to the world of federated tracing and large scale correlation. By indexing with traceparent, the correlated messages, in data lake and federation system, can be brought together.

Additionally, the W3C trace context headers can be stored as custom header properties, in message processing logs, in SAP Integration Suite. These settings can be achieved by (AI assisted) groovy scripting in SAP Integration Suite.

Below snippet reflects the extraction of traceparent and tracestate from the http header and setting the same as MPL's custom headers.

def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message)
    
    if(messageLog != null) {
        messageLog.addAttachmentAsString(attachmentName, body, "text/plain")
    } 
    def traceid = message.getHeader("traceparent", String.class)
    messageLog.addCustomHeaderProperty("traceparent", traceid)
    
    def tracestate = message.getHeader("tracestate", String.class)
    messageLog.addCustomHeaderProperty("tracestate", tracestate)

One can then view these custom headers, in Message Monitor section of SAP Integration Suite, as shown below:

 

The added custom attributes would be then visible, in SAP Cloud ALM as well, provided the respective SAP Integration Suite and  SAP Cloud ALM tenants are already dovetailed.

Harvest above insights and ideas and redefine the observability of supply chains !


References:
https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/message-processing-log-text-view?locale=en-US
https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/apis/raw-data-inbound-logs?locale=en-US

entry.title: Recap SAP Inside Track Barcelona 2025
entry.content:
SAP Inside Track Barcelona 2025: A Celebration of Community, Innovation, and Shared Knowledge.
What a journey it's been! Last November 14th, we wrapped up the 9th edition of SAP Inside Track Barcelona, and I'm still buzzing from the energy, connections, and incredible moments we shared together.

More Than Just an Event

There's something truly special about SAP Inside Track. Yes, it's about SAP technologies, innovation, and learning ‚Äî but at its core, it's about people. It's about creating a space where developers, consultants, architects, and SAP enthusiasts can come together, share their experiences, and build genuine connections that go beyond the professional realm.
This year, we brought together +100 passionate individuals in a historic Modernist building in the heart of Barcelona. From the moment the doors opened until the last photo was taken the spirit of community was palpable.


Knowledge That Inspires

The quality of sessions this year was outstanding. Our speakers delivered thought-provoking presentations covering the full spectrum of SAP technologies:

  • AI and Innovation: From Vision AI applications in quality management to conversational AI solutions that let you "talk" to your data
  • SAP BTP: Deep dives into the Business Technology Platform and its transformative capabilities of SAP Hana with Vector Engine and Knowledge Graph
  • Next-Generation Talent: Insights into how SAP University Alliances is empowering the future of our ecosystem
  • SAP BTP Real-World Solutions: Practical implementations of SAP Integration Suite, CAP, FIORI, Printing solution, Identity Services, sand more
  • Freelance market barometer 2025

A special highlight was the Spanish final of the AUSIA Hackathon -  AUSAPE final,  where we witnessed incredible creativity and problem-solving. Congratulations to SDG Group for their winning solution combining AI, data modeling, and planning on SAP BTP, and to Brait Partners for their innovative electronic invoicing automation platform. Both teams proved that new technologies have real, tangible applications in today's business landscape.

The Power of Community: A New Milestone

Speaking of community strength, I'm thrilled to share some exciting news that perfectly exemplifies what we've built together: three new extraordinary members from our community have just joined the SAP Champions program! This recognition is a testament to the collaborative spirit, knowledge sharing, and genuine passion that defines our Barcelona and Spain SAP ecosystem. It's proof that when we come together, support each other, and actively contribute to the community, incredible things happen. These achievements don't belong to individuals alone ‚Äî they're a reflection of the nurturing environment we've created through events like SIT Barcelona. Congratulations to our new Champions; you make us all proud! üèÜ @AAncos @DanielMateo @Lluis 


Gratitude to Those Who Made It Possible

None of this would have been possible without our amazing volunteering speakers who shared their expertise, experiences, and passion. Your willingness to prepare, present, and engage with attendees is what makes SIT Barcelona such a valuable learning experience. Thank you for your time, your knowledge, and your commitment to our community.
To our sponsors ‚Äî thank you for believing in the power of community events. Your support enables us to create these spaces where innovation flourishes and connections are made. You're not just supporting an event; you're investing in the growth and development of the SAP ecosystem in Spain.

And I must give a huge, heartfelt thank you to the entire SIT Barcelona organizing team, Llu√≠s, Mireia, Enric, Losel, Imma and Saul. Your dedication, countless hours of planning, problem-solving on the fly, and unwavering passion made this 9th edition possible. You are the backbone of this community, and working alongside each of you has been an absolute privilegeüíô

The Heart of It All: Community

What sets SAP Inside Track apart from other tech events is the genuine sense of community we've built together over these nine years. It's in the coffee conversations, the spontaneous debates about architecture patterns, the exchange of LinkedIn profiles, and yes, even in the collective patience when life happens (like dog medication time!).
I've seen friendships form, collaborations spark, and careers transform through the connections made at SIT Barcelona. Whether you're a first-time attendee or a veteran of all nine editions, everyone is welcomed with open arms into this wonderful ecosystem we've created together.

Looking Ahead

As we celebrate the success of our 9th edition, we're already excited about what's to come. The 10th anniversary of SIT Barcelona is on the horizon, and we have a feeling it's going to be something truly special.
To everyone who attended, spoke, sponsored, organized, or simply spread the word ‚Äî thank you. You are the reason SAP Inside Track Barcelona exists and thrives. You are the community.
Until next year, keep innovating, keep sharing, and keep being awesome! üöÄ

P.S. ‚Äî If you missed this edition or want to be part of this amazing community, stay tuned for announcements about SIT Barcelona 2026. Trust me, you don't want to miss the 10th anniversary!
#SITBarcelona #SAPInsideTrack #SAPCommunity #SAP #SAPBTP #SAPDevelopers #CommunityEvents #BarcelonaTech #TechCommunity

entry.title: How I Escaped Browser Tab Hell: A Lesson in Choosing the Right AI Tool
entry.content:
The Journey

The Problem: 10 Years of Digital Hoarding

After a decade at SAP, I was drowning in resources. My solution? Browser bookmarks that grew into an unmanageable mess. When Chrome introduced Tab Groups, I thought I'd found salvation‚Äîuntil I realized I was maintaining 200+ tabs across multiple groups. The anxiety from my digital FOMO was worse than ever.

Back to Basics (With a Twist)

I returned to curated bookmarks but with a new goal: create a "PM Toolbox" that I could easily maintain and share with colleagues across the organization. I built a clean bookmark folder and mirrored it on a wiki page.

The Maintenance Nightmare

Within weeks, reality hit: my bookmark folder evolved constantly, requiring manual wiki updates. Chrome's bookmark export format (the ancient Netscape standard) made extracting subsets error-prone and frustrating. I needed automation.

First Attempt: GenAI Fails the Coding Test

I tried using Claude 4.5 Sonnet through GenAI-XL. Despite multiple attempts, it couldn't handle Chrome's non-standard HTML format. It kept reaching for HTML parsing libraries that failed, then suggested an obscure Netscape parser that violated SAP standards. Dead end.

Second Attempt: GitHub Copilot Nails It

The next day, I switched to VSCode with GitHub Copilot. Here's what changed:
  1. I wrote clear requirements in a `.github/copilot-instructions.md` file, specifically calling out the Netscape format complexity
  2. Copilot enhanced my requirements, suggesting testing coverage and documentation guidelines (80% of the final instructions came from Copilot)
  3. I switched to Agent mode and prompted: "Please create the missing files. Do not reference public code in your response." (Critical for enterprise compliance)
The result? A complete, working script‚Äîinstantly.

But it got better. When I asked for a second script to generate Confluence tables, Copilot:
  • Created the implementation
  • Built the test suite when I requested it
  • Ran the tests autonomously, discovered bugs, and fixed them‚Äîall without me asking
I was genuinely amazed.

Key Takeaways

1. Match the Tool to the Task

  • General AI (like Claude): Excellent for brainstorming, requirements refinement, and PM tasks
  • Specialized coding AI (like GitHub Copilot): Purpose-built for implementation and testing

2. Clear Requirements Are Non-Negotiable

Both attempts used AI, but only the second succeeded because I provided structured, detailed requirements upfront.

3. Embrace Test-Driven Development

Even with AI assistance, automated testing is essential. Copilot's self-correction only worked because tests exposed the bugs immediately.

4. Simple Solutions Often Win

Sometimes the answer isn't a shinier tool‚Äîit's going back to basics (curated bookmarks) with smart automation layered on top.

The Bottom Line

AI coding assistants aren't magic‚Äîthey're power tools. Like any tool, they require the right context, clear instructions, and quality controls. When you provide those, the results can be transformative.

For PMs and non-developers: you don't need to be a coder to automate your work. You just need to understand your requirements so you can clearly write them down and choose the AI tool designed for the job.

References

You can find the scripts in question here

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay 2025: Premios de SAP Press, los grandes ganadores de la noche
entry.content:
Durante el a√±o 2025 organizamos el primer SAP Inside Track en Paraguay Ciudad del Este, un evento hist√≥rico donde m√°s de 100 profesionales SAP se reunieron para compartir conocimientos, hacer networking y celebrar nuestra pasi√≥n por la tecnolog√≠a.


¬øPor Qu√© Participar en un SAP Inside Track?
Los eventos SAP Inside Track son espacios √∫nicos donde la comunidad SAP cobra vida:

  • Aprender de expertos con experiencia real en proyectos SAP
  • Hacer networking con consultores, desarrolladores y usuarios clave
  • Mantenerse actualizado con las √∫ltimas tendencias y mejores pr√°cticas
  • Compartir experiencias y soluciones con colegas del ecosistema SAP
  • Fortalecer la comunidad local y crear conexiones profesionales duraderas

Gracias a Todos
Nuestro m√°s sincero agradecimiento a quienes hicieron posible este evento: los asistentes por su entusiasmo y participaci√≥n, los speakers por compartir su conocimiento, los voluntarios por su dedicaci√≥n incansable, y todos los sponsors por creer en nuestra visi√≥n y apoyar el crecimiento de la comunidad SAP en Paraguay.


Un Agradecimiento Especial a SAP Press
Queremos destacar especialmente el apoyo de SAP Press, quien como patrocinador oficial del evento, contribuy√≥ significativamente a hacer de este SIT una experiencia inolvidable. SAP Press no solo aport√≥ su prestigio y respaldo al evento, sino que tambi√©n puso a disposici√≥n de los participantes 4 e-books de su cat√°logo como premios durante el evento.
Este tipo de apoyo es fundamental para motivar la participaci√≥n, premiar el compromiso de nuestra comunidad y brindar acceso a recursos de aprendizaje de primera calidad. SAP Press ha sido y contin√∫a siendo un aliado invaluable en el desarrollo profesional de miles de profesionales SAP en todo el mundo.

¬°Felicitaciones a Nuestros Ganadores!
Durante el evento, tuvimos el placer de sortear 4 e-books de SAP Press entre nuestros participantes. Nos complace anunciar a los afortunados ganadores:

  • Blanca Lezme

  • Martha Ayala Jara 

  • Pablo Jorge Berganza Carvallo

  • Vanessa Maria Jose Guillen Arg√ºello

¬°Felicitaciones a todos los ganadores! Esperamos que disfruten de sus libros y que el conocimiento adquirido les sea de gran utilidad en sus carreras profesionales.

Mirando Hacia el Futuro
El √©xito de este primer SAP Inside Track Paraguay nos llena de orgullo y nos motiva a seguir adelante. Nuestro compromiso es claro: queremos que este sea el primero de muchos eventos.
Ya estamos so√±ando con el SAP Inside Track Paraguay 2026, y esperamos contar nuevamente con el apoyo de sponsors como SAP Press, con m√°s participantes, m√°s contenido de calidad y, por supuesto, ¬°m√°s premios para nuestra comunidad!

¬øQuieres Ser Parte del Pr√≥ximo Evento?
Si participas en nuestro pr√≥ximo SAP Inside Track, no solo tendr√°s acceso a contenido de primer nivel y oportunidades de networking invaluables, sino que tambi√©n podr√°s participar en sorteos de premios como los e-books de SAP Press y otros beneficios que nuestros sponsors pondr√°n a disposici√≥n.

No te pierdas la oportunidad de ser parte de esta comunidad vibrante y en crecimiento.

Mantente atento a nuestros canales oficiales para conocer las fechas y detalles del pr√≥ximo evento. Mientras tanto, te invitamos a unirte a la SAP Community Group de Asunci√≥n para estar al d√≠a con todas las novedades.

¬°Gracias y Hasta Pronto!
Desde el equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay, queremos agradecer una vez m√°s a todos los que hicieron posible este sue√±o. Este es solo el comienzo de algo grande.
